en: The burden of the wilderness of the sea. As whirlwinds in the South sweep through, it cometh from the wilderness, from a terrible land.
hmr: Tuipui thlalêr phurrik chu. Sim rama thlivir a fe thlengin thlalêra inthawkin, ram ṭiumtaka inthawk chun, a hung ie.

en: A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous man dealeth treacherously, and the destroyer destroyeth. Go up, O Elam; besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.
hmr: Inlârna khirkhântak el ka kuomah inhriettir a ni tah; vervêktaka thawtu chun vervêktakin a thawh a, rawktu chun a rawk a. Aw Elam mihai, hang fe ro; aw Media mihai, inhuol ro; an inrûmna po po chu ka sukbo vawng tah.

en: Therefore are my loins filled with anguish; pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman in travail: I am pained so that I cannot hear; I am dismayed so that I cannot see.
hmr: Chuleiin, ka kâwnghai hi natna nasatakin a sip a, nuhmei nau invawi natna angin natnain nasatakin a mi man tah; naa hre thei naw khawp hielin na ka tuor a; khaw hmu thei lo khawp hielin ka lunginzîng a.

en: My heart fluttereth, horror hath affrighted me; the twilight that I desired hath been turned into trembling unto me.
hmr: Ka lungril hi ân thuok hlawp hlawp a, thil râpthlâktakin a mi suklâu a; zântieng dei ka nghâkhla hlak kha ka ta dingin inthinnaah ân chang a,

en: They prepare the table, they set the watch, they eat, they drink: rise up, ye princes, anoint the shield.
hmr: Dawkân chu an buotsai a, râlvêngtu chu an invêngtir a, an fâk a, an dâwn a; mi lienhai, tho unla phaw kha hriek nâl ro.

en: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Go, set a watchman; let him declare what he seeth:
hmr: LALPA chun ka kuomah hieng ang hin a hril a nih, “Fe la, râlvêngtu invêngtir rawh; ama chun a thil hmu chu hril raw se.

en: and when he seeth a troop, horsemen in pairs, a troop of asses, a troop of camels, he shall hearken diligently with much heed.
hmr: Chun, sipai pâwl dâm, sakawr chung chuong a kawp peia fe dâm, sabengtung pâwl dâm, sanghâwngsei pâwl dâm, a hmu pha chun ngun- takin ngai kieu a tih,” tiin.

en: And he cried as a lion: O Lord, I stand continually upon the watch-tower in the day-time, and am set in my ward whole nights;
hmr: Chun, ama chu sakeibaknei angin a khêk a, “Aw Lalpa, sûna chun râlvêng bûk chunga hin ka ngîr rawp a, zânkhawvârin ka vêngnaa hin i mîn umtir rawp a;

en: and, behold, here cometh a troop of men, horsemen in pairs. And he answered and said, Fallen, fallen is Babylon; and all the graven images of her gods are broken unto the ground.
hmr: ngai ta, hitaka hin mihriem pâwl, sakawr chung chuong a kawp peia fe an hung ie,” tiin. Chun, ama bawk chun, “Babulon khuo chu a tlâwm tah, a tlâwm tah; an thiempu- hai milim siem fâwmhai po po chu hnuoia suknâwiin a um tah,” tiin a dawn a.

en: O thou my threshing, and the grain of my floor! that which I have heard from Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you.
hmr: Aw ka bu vuok sa, ka hrizâwla bu; sipaihai LALPA Israelhai Pa- thiena inthawka ka hriet chu ka hril cheu a ni hi.

en: The burden of Dumah. One calleth unto me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?
hmr: Duma phurrik chu. Miin Seir tlânga inthawkin an mi ko a, “Râl- vêngtu, zân hi iengtin am a ni tah a? Râlvêngtu, zân hi iengtin am a ni tah a?” tiin.

en: The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will inquire, inquire ye: turn ye, come.
hmr: Râlvêngtu chun, “Zîngkâr a hung ni ding a ni tah, zân khawm: in indawn nuom chun indawn ro: nghakîr nâwk unla, hung ro,” a ta.

en: The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye caravans of Dedanites.
hmr: Arabia ram chunga phurrik chu. Aw Dedanhai khuol inzin pâwl tinhai, Arabia rama ramhnuoiah riek in tih. Dangchâr kuoma chun tui an hung lâk a.

en: Unto him that was thirsty they brought water; the inhabitants of the land of Tema did meet the fugitives with their bread.
hmr: Tema rama umhai chun an buin tlân hmanghai chu an tuok a.

en: For they fled away from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.
hmr: Kâwlhnâmhaia inthawkin, kâwlhnâm phawisahaia inthawkin le, thalngul kuoisaa inthawk le indona nasataka inthawka tlân hmang an ni sih a.

en: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of a hireling, all the glory of Kedar shall fail;
hmr: Lalpa chun hieng ang hin ka kuomah a hril sih a, “Inhlawfa kum tiema kum khat sûngin Kedarhai ropuina po po chu bo zo vawng a ta,

en: and the residue of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be few; for Jehovah, the God of Israel, hath spoken it.
hmr: thal kâp mi, Kedar thlahai laia mi hrât tak la um sunhai chu, tlâwmte nîng an tih: LALPA Israelhai Pathien chun chu chu a hril ta sih a,” tiin.
